awd_titl_txt: Small-Scale, Shear-Driven Irregularities and Associated     Particle Heating
awd_abstract_narration: The objective of the proposal is to utilize laboratory plasma  experiments to identify the physics and characterize the signatures  of space-relevant fluctuations, small-scale irregularities, and  particle heating induced by velocity-shear driven mechanisms.  In  particular, the project will attempt to, 1.) determine the  dependence of Kelvin-Helmholz, inhomogeneous energy-density driven,  and electron-ion hybrid Kelvin-Helmholtz excitation thresholds on  shear parameters, 2.) test the ability to seed shear-driven  turbulence at the edges of nonlinearly evolved Kelvin-Helmholtz  vortices in plasma potential, 3.) distinguish the ion heating  induced by different shear-driven waves from that resulting from  current-driven waves, and 4.) determine the influence of  introducing small concentrations of a second positive-ion species  on items 1-3 above.  The specific long range goals are to improve  the interpretation of the dynamically intense geomagnetic activity  that arises at the edges of auroral arcs and in black aurora and to  provide quantitative comparisons to theoretical models used to  interpret space observations.
org_div_long_name: Division of Atmospheric and Geospace Sciences
